sentences.sContent: The rules are intended to prevent accidents.
sentences.sCn: 这些规定旨在预防事故。

sentences.sContent: We were prevented from entering the site.
Wrap small ornaments in paper to prevent them being damaged.
sentences.sCn: 把小饰品用纸包上以免损坏。

sentences.sContent: ...the government has taken a variety of measures to prevent the disaster...
...They might even feel driven to support government measures to prevent people from consuming this deadly stuff...
...because they wanted to prevent damage to their unborn babies...
...letting them move around the classroom and getting them to compete in teams to prevent boredom...

phrases.pCn: 防治污染；预防和控制污染

words.tran: 可预防的；可阻止的；可防止的
预期的；以前的；预防的；先行的

trans.tranOther: to stop something from happening, or stop someone from doing something
